meta.content: The most interesting and talked about stories, videos and pictures on the web. Breaking news on Technology, Politics, Entertainment, and more!

meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: INEQUALITY
The typical American family spends half its income on housing and transportation. The typical Egyptian family spends half its income on food.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QL2zPX&via=Digg&text=How The World Spends Money

div.div: NEWS TO TEMPER YOUR ROAD RAGE

div.a: Take A Deep Breath: Carmageddon 2.0 Is Here

div.div: Take the time to enjoy a deep breath next weekend when the 405 freeway closes for Carmageddon II. If it's anything like last year, the air quality is about to get amazing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PdCK9R&via=Digg&text=Take A Deep Breath: Carmageddon 2.0 Is Here

div.div: WHAT BATTLESTAR GALACTICA GETS RIGHT
Naval analyst Chris Weuve talks about what Battlestar Galactica gets right about space warfare.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q9awiN&via=Digg&text=Aircraft Carriers In Space

div.div: NSFW

div.a: Fox News Anchor Apologizes For Airing Live Suicide

div.div: Shepard Smith's face in this photo tells the story about this awful situation: Here he's seen immediately after Fox News had aired a car chase (live, without a delay) that ended with a suspect shooting himself in the head. Immediately after, they cut to a commercial about mesothelioma.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RoG4Ty&via=Digg&text=Fox News Anchor Apologizes For Airing Live Suicide

div.div: AND YOU THOUGHT SEASON 1 WAS BAD

div.a: George R.R. Martin Is Planning To Hide From You After A Specific Episode Next Season

div.div: You know when that thing happened to Ned Stark in Season 1 of HBO’s Game of Thrones and everyone who hadn’t read the book (and some who had) completely freaked out? There’s more stuff like that to come and A Song of Ice and Fire author George R.R. Martin is kind of scared about how you’ll react.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VVVakh&via=Digg&text=George R.R. Martin Is Planning To Hide From You After A Specific Episode Next Season

div.div: JONAH LEHRER FOUND A NEW GIG

div.a: Iranian News Agency Falls For Onion Story, Plagiarizes It

div.div: Readers of Iran's official FARS News Agency encountered a surprising headline today -- "Gallup Poll: Rural Whites Prefer Ahmadinejad to Obama"

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S62iw0&via=Digg&text=Iranian News Agency Falls For Onion Story, Plagiarizes It

div.div: AT LEAST IT'S NOT YELLOW

div.a: 'Poo Mountain': Sewage To Snow On Ski Resort?

div.div: This ski season an Arizona resort is planning to use sewage to make snow for its slopes. Green destination or gross desecration? Opposite sides of the poo mountain proposal are battling it out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sei6HC&via=Digg&text='Poo Mountain': Sewage To Snow On Ski Resort?

div.div: GALLOPING MACHINES

div.a: A Brief History Of Mechanical Horses

div.div: Before we dreamed of driverless cars, we dreamed of horseless horses.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SHXFYB&via=Digg&text=A Brief History Of Mechanical Horses

div.div: MAPS FAIL

div.a: Apple and Nokia Conceal Fewer Sensitive Sites Than Google Maps

div.div: iOS 6 Maps is the most transparent of the three — but is that a good thing?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OZUtqF&via=Digg&text=Apple and Nokia Conceal Fewer Sensitive Sites Than Google Maps

div.div: REVENGE IS A DISH BEST SERVED ONLINE

div.a: Man Loses Xbox Account To Thief, Gives Thief Virtual Smackdown

div.div: On Sunday night, Eric Graff put his son to bed. He flipped on his 360 and got ready for a session of Borderlands 2 with some friends. But when he tried to log onto his Xbox Live account, the password wouldn't work. His account had been hacked.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PsFIsh&via=Digg&text=Man Loses Xbox Account To Thief, Gives Thief Virtual Smackdown

div.div: 2012 ELECTION

div.a: The Impact Of Romney's '47 Percent' Secret Recording

div.div: A week and a half has passed since Mr. Romney’s remarks became known to the public — meaning that there’s been enough time to evaluate their effect on the polls.There’s a case to be made that they did damage Mr. Romney’s standing some.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/USdAUY&via=Digg&text=The Impact Of Romney's '47 Percent' Secret Recording

div.div: CONFESSION IN 140 CHARACTERS

div.a: Can The Vatican Survive The Digital Age?

div.div: If it does not want to be defined by others, the Church must respond to and even court public opinion, using modern media to shape its message.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q97I5a&via=Digg&text=Can The Vatican Survive The Digital Age?

div.div: AT-AT's FOUGHT IN WORLD WAR II?!
The mission of If Star Wars Was Real.com is to painstakingly document photographic evidence that Star Wars was, in fact, real, a historical happenstance forgotten or ignored by most historians.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P0h0Uv&via=Digg&text=If Star Wars Was Real

div.div: IN CASE YOU'VE BEEN SLEEPING

div.a: The Month Of September In Charts

div.div: September brought Americans together with culture, politics, sports, technology, and—as usual—outrage. I Love Charts brings together the most graphable moments of the month.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VTwOb1&via=Digg&text=The Month Of September In Charts

div.div: URBAN CRIME: BANAL EDITION

div.a: NYPD Taking Jaywalking Seriously For Some Reason

div.div: Despite the dangers of jaywalking, it seems that red flashing hand is more of a suggestion than a law. Evidently, some NYPD officers don't see it that way.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PvTB9b&via=Digg&text=NYPD Taking Jaywalking Seriously For Some Reason

div.div: CHECK BEFORE YOU BOOK YOUR NEXT FLIGHT

div.a: These Airplanes Have The Most Crashes

div.div: A plane crash in Nepal has left 19 people dead. How do the top airliners compare for safety?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PdO0Tx&via=Digg&text=These Airplanes Have The Most Crashes

div.div: BEST TRICK PLAY EVER

div.a: Backwards, Over-The-Head, Game-Tying Throw Is The Play Of The Year

div.div: You want the football play of the year? It came on a two point conversion in a high school game, where a team used an over the head, back-to-the goal pass to a leaping tight end to knot up a game and send it to overtime.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q8IV1m&via=Digg&text=Backwards, Over-The-Head, Game-Tying Throw Is The Play Of The Year

div.div: DON'T WORRY, APPLE MAPS DESTROYED IT

div.a: Google Street View Captures 'UFO' In Texas

div.div: Andrea Dove, who lives outside Houston, Texas, was using Google Maps to get directions to a relative’s house when she made an interesting discovery on Street View: something that resembles a fading, pinkish UFO straight out of cartoon sci-fi.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NVt1ZT&via=Digg&text=Google Street View Captures 'UFO' In Texas

div.div: META

div.a: Van Gogh's Starry Night Made From Pics Of Real Galaxies

div.div: The Hubble Telescope recreates the iconic painting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VVcqGl&via=Digg&text=Van Gogh's Starry Night Made From Pics Of Real Galaxies

div.div: MIND-MELTING PHOTOS

American artist Josh Sommers is constantly challenging our understanding of the world. Deciphering his many surreal images is quite a feat, as you can see here in his Mind Melting Photo Manipulations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QrOV7l&via=Digg&text=Shockingly Surreal Warped Out Worlds

div.div: HELLO? YES, THIS IS KI-MOON
A pair of Quebec radio personalities known for prank phone calls are boasting of another victim — the Secretary General of the United Nations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VUKdzy&via=Digg&text=Ban Ki-Moon Gets Pranked
